text: Sakina Boutamine (born 2 June 1953) is a retired Algerian female middle- distance runner who specialised in 1500 metres and 3000 metres. She won gold medals in both events in the inaugural 1979 African Championships in Dakar. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1978 |rowspan=2|All-Africa Games |rowspan=2|Algiers, Algeria |bgcolor="silver"| 2nd |800 m |2:05.64 |- |bgcolor="gold"| 1st |1500 m |4:16.43 |- |rowspan=3|1979 |rowspan=2|African Championships |rowspan=2|Dakar, Senegal |bgcolor="gold"| 1st |1500 m |4:23.6 (a) |- |bgcolor="gold"| 1st |3000 m |9:31.1 (a) |- |Mediterranean Games |Split, Yugoslavia |bgcolor="cc9966"|3rd |1500 m |4:10.60 |- !colspan="6"|Representing 20px Africa |- |1977 |IAAF World Cup |Düsseldorf, West Germany |6th |1500 m |4.18.5 |- |rowspan=2|1979 |rowspan=2|IAAF World Cup |rowspan=2|Montreal, Canada |4th |1500 m |4.12.13 |- |7th |3000 m |9.30.73 |- |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1953 births Category:Living people Category:Algerian female middle-distance runners Category:African Games gold medalists for Algeria Category:African Games silver medalists for Algeria Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Mediterranean Games bronze medalists for Algeria Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1979 Mediterranean Games Category:Mediterranean Games medalists in athletics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1978 All-Africa Games
title: Sakina Boutamine
